alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:37PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. This system will produce heavy rain along with gusty winds, particularly Friday night through Saturday afternoon. 48 hours storm total rainfall is expected to be 1 to 3 inches, and up to 4 inches near Pelican. The heavy rain will produce fast rises on small and flashy streams but after 2 days of little to no rain, rivers and lakes trended down and will help to mitigate the flooding threat. Conditions are expected to improve gradually through the day on Sunday. If you have plans this weekend check back for updates on this evolving event.
